item.title: 10 Key Design Trends For 2016 (And How To Make The Most Of Them)
item.description:
10 Key Design Trends For 2016 (And How To Make The Most Of Them)

Apps as we know them will disappear. Luxury will trickle down to the masses. VR will go mainstream. These are just a few of the major design and technology trends shaping the world in 2016. The trends we've identified focus on issues we-a firm with over 600 designers and developers-expect to tackle in the coming year.

item.title: Cooper + Studio Dental: Shining a Spotlight On Service Design
item.description:
Cooper + Studio Dental: Shining a Spotlight On Service Design

As part of our continuing mentorship program at Rock Health, Cooper teamed up with Studio Dental co-founders Dr. Sara Creighton and Lowell Caulder to help them disrupt the dental industry with their mobile dental service. The startup gained early support from a successful $40K Indiegogo campaign, and for Cooper, this project has been a great opportunity to demonstrate the value of service design.

item.title: Practical Service Design - guides, resources, and community
item.description:
Practical Service Design - guides, resources, and community

Our world is now made of services. We need new tools to think across this space, to not only create memorable and valuable experiences for our customers, but also empower our organizations to change the way we do business for the better.

item.title: Oslo University Hospital - Changing the lives of breast cancer patients
item.description:
Oslo University Hospital - Changing the lives of breast cancer patients

Women with a heightened risk of developing breast cancer waited up to three months before they were appointed a time at the Oslo University Hospital for examination and diagnosis. Inefficient, outdated and suboptimal, the processes did not take into account the stress of having to wait for a life-changing verdict.

item.title: The Most Important Design Jobs Of The Future
item.description:
The Most Important Design Jobs Of The Future

Yesterday's graphic designers are today's UX designers. Will tomorrow's UX designers will be avatar programmers, fusionists, and artificial organ designers? Yes, according to the illustrious roster of design leaders we spoke with here.

item.title: Designing for Culture: Creating the Perfect UX Persona
item.description:
Designing for Culture: Creating the Perfect UX Persona

Knowing your user is one thing. Knowing about their culture is another. Creating a UX persona becomes quite a different thing when you consider someone's culture. Persona evolves based on imagery, language, color and audience. It's important that you take all of these cultural factors into consideration when designing your interfaces.

item.title: Design Workflow with Sketch, a new free e-course by InVision
item.description:
Design Workflow with Sketch, a new free e-course by InVision

Learn how to use Sketch to accelerate and perfect your design workflow in this free ecourse by Clark Wimberly.
